channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Double yellow line road markings, 1st August
item.description:
The residents of this narrow cul-de-sac campaigned some year ago to stop parking of vehicles as it was causing problems due to being close to the main road and school. This was finally solved as the refuse collectors were having problems getting in to our street and decided that they would not collect our rubbish unless they could get their truck near to our houses. We eventually had double yellow lines put around our cul-de-sac. Since then the road markings have worn down and we constantly get cars parking on the road markings and even on the pavement. The dentists in Hook Lane even tell their patients to park round here! PLEASE can we have the road markings re-done and even extended up to the point of the turning circle. With grateful thanks For and on behalf of the residents, many of who are elderly and infirm and may need emergency vehicles. Neighbourhood Watch Co-Ordinator
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Leonards Close, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The manhole cover is rocking, 1st August
item.description:
The manhole cover on the street right before the traffic lights near 541 Old Kent road is loose and rocking. It is extremely loud and keeps us up at night as traffic here is constant. It is also dangerous and cyclist have to avoid it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 525, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Tree hugely overgrown, 1st August
item.description:
Tree is blocking light, branches low hanging and causing issues with access to houses. Impacting on telephone wires. Foliage taking over the fronts of houses even days after being swept away. Drains blocked. Removal of foliage not the issue, tree in desperate need of substantial trimming

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holmdene Avenue, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant littering and no public bin in area!, 1st August
item.description:
We live on this street and there is just constantly litter on the street, but mainly around the bus stop on Fenn Street and there is no public bin for people to throw rubbish away, and so the problem doesn't ever improve.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Fenn Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Outside 136 Victoria Road, 1st August
item.description:
A car driver lost control last night and smashed into our wall and garden, pughing thorugh the parking pole (which smashed our front tiles). It has been put back upright but is not safe and needs to be removed. There is also oil from their car engine on the pavement and our front step. The fire brigade put some sand down last night.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
